1.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.

2.text: Every branch in me not bearing fruit he takes away: and every one bearing fruit, he cleanses it, that it might bear more fruit.

3.text: Already are ye clean, through the word which I have spoken to you.

4.text: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, if it remain not in the vine; so neither ye, if ye remain not in me.

5.text: I am the vine, ye the branches: he remaining in me, and I in him, he bears much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.

6.text: If any remain not in me, he was cast forth as the branch, and was dried up; and they gather them together, and cast into the fire, and they are burned.

7.text: If ye remain in me, and my words remain in you, ye shall ask whatever ye wish, and it shall be to you.

8.text: In this was my Father honoured, that ye should bear much fruit: and ye shall be disciples to me.

9.text: As the Father loved me, I also loved you: remain in my love.

10.text: If ye keep my commands, ye shall remain in my love; as I have kept my Fatherâ€™s commands, and remain in his love.

11.text: These things have I spoken to you, that my joy might remain in you, and your joy might be completed.

12.text: This is my command, That ye love one another, as I loved you.

13.text: Greater love than this has none, that any lay down his life for his friends.

14.text: Ye are my friends, if ye do whatever I command you.

15.text: I no more call you servants; for the servant knows not what his lord does: and I have called you friends; for all which I heard of my Father I made known to you.

16.text: Ye chose not me, but I chose you, and I have set you, that ye might retire and bear fruit, and your fruit remain: that whatever ye ask the Father in my name, he might give you.

17.text: These things I command you, that ye love one another.

18.text: If the world hate you, know that it has hated me the first of you.

19.text: If ye were of the world, the world had loved its own: and because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

20.text: Remember the word which I said to you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they expelled me, they will also expel you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.

21.text: But all these will they do to you for my name, for they know not him having sent me.

22.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they had not sin and now they have no pretext for their sin.

23.text: He hating me hates my Father also.

24.text: If I did not the works in them which none other has done, they had not sin: and now have they also seen and hated also me and my Father.

25.text: But that the word written in their law might be completed, That they hated me gratuitously.

26.text: And when the Intercessor should come, which I will send you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, which comes from the Father, he shall testify of me:

27.text: And ye also testify, for ye are with me from the beginning.
